Package org.cesecore.util

Class QueryResultWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.util.QueryResultWrapper
  • public abstract class QueryResultWrapper
extends Object
    Helper class to cope with Hibernates JPA 1.0 Provider implementation.
    Version:
    $Id: QueryResultWrapper.java 17625 2013-09-20 07:12:06Z netmackan $

      static <T> T getLastResult​(javax.persistence.Query query)  
      static <T> T getSingleResult​(javax.persistence.Query query)
      Query.getSingleResult that on with older Hibernate JPA 1.0 provider bundled with EJBCA returns null and on newer JPA implementations throws NoResultException (as it should according to the specifications) is not suitable for EJBCA.
      static <T> T getSingleResult​(javax.persistence.Query query, T defaultValue)
      Query.getSingleResult that on with older Hibernate JPA 1.0 provider bundled with EJBCA returns null and on newer JPA implementations throws NoResultException (as it should according to the specifications) is not suitable for EJBCA.

    • Method Detail

      • getSingleResult

        public static <T> T getSingleResult​(javax.persistence.Query query)
        Query.getSingleResult that on with older Hibernate JPA 1.0 provider bundled with EJBCA returns null and on newer JPA implementations throws NoResultException (as it should according to the specifications) is not suitable for EJBCA. We always want to return null when an object does not exist, since exceptions will mess with the garbage collection and lead to worse performance. We still throws NonUniqueResultException and IllegalStateException, just as getSingleResult would.
        Type Parameters:
        T - response type
        Parameters:
        query - query
        Returns:
        single result or null

      • getSingleResult

        public static <T> T getSingleResult​(javax.persistence.Query query,
                                    T defaultValue)
        Query.getSingleResult that on with older Hibernate JPA 1.0 provider bundled with EJBCA returns null and on newer JPA implementations throws NoResultException (as it should according to the specifications) is not suitable for EJBCA. We always want to return null when an object does not exist, since exceptions will mess with the garbage collection and lead to worse performance. We still throws NonUniqueResultException and IllegalStateException, just as getSingleResult would.
        Type Parameters:
        T - response type
        Parameters:
        query - Query
        defaultValue - default value
        Returns:
        single result or defaultValue

      • getLastResult

        public static <T> T getLastResult​(javax.persistence.Query query)
        Type Parameters:
        T - response type
        Parameters:
        query - query
        Returns:
        the first result of the query or null
